Class MummyNode

java.lang.Object
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.entity.node.movable.MovableNode
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.entity.node.movable.enemy.EnemyNode
com.platformer.escape_beyond.model.entity.node.movable.enemy.MummyNode
public class MummyNode extends EnemyNode
Represents a Mummy enemy in the game, which moves within a specified range.

This class extends EnemyNode and uses the LineMove strategy to define its movement behavior. The Mummy enemy moves back and forth in a straight line between the boundaries defined by its range.

This class is part of the implementation of the Strategy Design Pattern, where different types of enemies can have varied movement behaviors assigned dynamically.

  • Constructor Details

    • MummyNode

      public MummyNode(String enemyType, javafx.scene.Node node, int[] range)
      Constructs a new MummyNode object.

      Initializes the mummy's movement behavior using the LineMove strategy, which makes it move horizontally between the specified range at a constant velocity. The velocity is defined by MUMMY_MOVING_VELOCITY.

      Parameters:
      enemyType - A String representing the type of the enemy (e.g., "mummy").
      node - The Node object representing the graphical element of the mummy. This is typically a JavaFX graphical component.
      range - An integer array specifying the movement boundaries for the mummy. The array should have two elements: the starting x-coordinate and the ending x-coordinate. For example, range = [100, 300] makes the mummy move between x=100 and x=300.
